title: Structured Learning of Electrical Concepts: Integrated Theory and Practice Course

context.prior_knowledge: Basic physics knowledge and understanding of electrical circuit components
context.additional_context: Case-based education considering the work/life relevance for adult learners.

learning_goals: Learners can quantitatively explain the interaction of electrical circuit components (resistance, voltage, current)
Learners can perform circuit analysis by applying Ohm’s Law and Kirchhoff’s Laws
Learners can analyze electrical phenomena and predict experimental results using simulation tools
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
